author: zee business
title: Major milestone for Indian sports: Gujarat CM on 2030 Commonwealth Games
text:
Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel on Wednesday said that the 2030 Commonwealth Games would be hosted in India. He called it a huge milestone for the sports sector, infrastructure, and India’s global capabilities under the leadership of PM Modi.
“Hosting the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Gujarat will be a matter of pride for all Indians". It will also expand sports facilities and provide youth and athletes with new opportunities, such as training, employment, and international exposure,” said Bhupendra Patel.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised India for being awarded the hosting rights for the 100th Commonwealth Games, highlighting that the country's “collective commitment, efforts, and spirit of sportsmanship” have placed India strongly on the global sporting map.
In a post on X, PM Modi said, “Delighted that India has won the bid to host the Centenary Commonwealth Games 2030! Congratulations to the people of India and the sporting ecosystem. It is all the hard work, our collective commitment, and spirit of sportsmanship that has placed India on the global sporting map. With the beliefs of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam, we are eager to celebrate these historic games with great enthusiasm. We look forward to welcoming the world!”
External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar called India’s successful bid to host the Commonwealth Games 2030 in Ahmedabad a “proud moment for Bharat,” describing it as a testament to Prime Minister Modi's commitment to world-class infrastructure and athletic excellence.
Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said it is a proud moment for the nation and will provide athletes a significant opportunity to showcase their skills during the Commonwealth movement’s 100th year.
Vice President CP Radhakrishnan praised the announcement, calling it a “significant and encouraging milestone” for Indian sports.
ICC Chairman Jay Shah expressed happiness on X, saying, “A proud moment for India with Ahmedabad confirmed to host the Centenary Commonwealth Games 2030.”
At the same time, the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) in Glasgow officially designated Ahmedabad as the host city for the 2030 Commonwealth Games.
Following Ahmedabad’s announcement, 20 Garba dancers and 30 Indian dhol drummers performed in the General Assembly Hall, giving delegates a glimpse of the cultural heritage and pride that athletes and fans can expect in Gujarat.
